items.itemDescription: This Bezl provides a bit of a CRM view to your customer information, allowing you to see your assigned accounts, drill in for more details, and even record call logs.  A great way to make your non-mobile CRM available on devices like iPhone, iPad, Android, etc.

itemImages.imageAltText: Full image showing accounts view drilled into a specific account.
Screenshot showing where you can record a call log.

installationNotes.intro: This Bezl does not yet conform to the standard steps to change data sources (this is on the roadmap).  For now, in order to use this Bezl you must create a plugin instance called sales-rep-queries and point it to a SQL Server query folder containing the .SQL files from one of the atatched ZIP files.  Please contact support if you wish to activate this Bezl in your account and are having difficulties.

items.itemDescription: This Bezl uses a multi-level pie chart to help visualize the AP aging by category in a single view.  The first level of the pie chart breaks down accounts payable by the number of days they are due within while the second level breaks down by category (for example, raw materials, subcontract labor, etc).

items.itemDescription: This Bezl allows you to run any Crystal Reports with fresh data directly within Bezlio.  Regardless of your device (iPhone, iPad, Android, PC, or Mac) you will be able to run your Crystal Reports from anywhere with refreshed data.  Reports have parameters?  No problem!  When the reports are published to Bezlio (as simple putting them in a folder in your network) we dynamically look for parameters and will prompt for them using mobile-friendly inputs.  Once you are viewing the report in Bezlio you can then export it to a variety of formats including Excel and PDF.
items.thumbnailAltText: Screenshot showing a Crystal Report presented within Bezlio.

itemImages.imageAltText: Screenshot showing a Crystal Report presented within Bezlio.
Screenshot showing Crystal Reports on an iPhone.
Screenshot showing report listing.
Screenshot showing how you can export to Excel, PDF, Word all from within Bezlio.

installationNotes.intro: The default installation of BRDB with the Crystal Reports plugin expects your published reports to be placed at C:\Program Files (x86)\Bezlio Remote Data Broker\CrystalReports\ and not require credentials. To change these settings or understand more about the plugin, review it's documentation here.

items.itemDescription: This Bezl shows various customer satisfaction metrics on a scale of 0 to 5 with progress bars.  Metrics are automatically detected from the query / Excel file so simply edit the queries or file to suit your needs.  If you wish for metrics to be scored on a scale other than 0 to 5, simply edit the onDataChange function as needed.
items.thumbnailAltText: Screenshot showing various customer satisfaction scores.

itemImages.imageAltText: Screenshot showing various customer satisfaction scores.

additionalFiles.description: Sample Excel data source for this Bezl.  Installed by default with latest version of BRDB.
SQL Server query for Epicor ERP 10.X. This assumes Number01, Number02, and Number03 are used for sample metrics.  Edit as needed.
SQL Server query for Epicor ERP 9.05 and prior. This assumes Number01, Number02, and Number03 are used for sample metrics.  Edit as needed.
SQL Server query for all versions of INFOR Visual. This assumes USER_1, USER_2, and USER_3 are used for sample metrics.  Edit as needed.

installationNotes.intro: When you install this Bezl it will by default point to accounts-payable.xlsx which should already be present on your BRDB server. If you wish to point to a different data source, refer to our standard steps for changing data connections. It is expected that a single row be returned with columns for each metric (dynamic).

items.itemDescription: This Bezl uses a tree map to help visualize both the cost and age of inventory by warehouse into a single view.  Each warehouse is represented as a container with boxes within for each item in that warehouse.  The larger the box for a given item, the greater the cost associated.  And the color of the box goes from white to red based on relative age.  This clever visualization allows a user to instantly guage and compare the health of warehouses by how 'red' they are and then dig deeper by hovering over the biggest, reddest boxes to find the problems.
items.thumbnailAltText: Screenshot showing inventory valuation over 4 fictional warehouses

itemImages.imageAltText: Screenshot showing inventory valuation over 4 fictional warehouses

If you wish to point to a different data source, refer to our standard steps for changing data connections. Required columns names are Location, Product, Age, and Cost.

items.itemDescription: This Bezl allows a production worker to issue materials to a job / work order from mobile devices (iPhone, iPad, Android, etc.)  Currently it is only configured for Epicor, but will be ported to other systems in the weeks to come.  Bezl is intended to be very touch and barcode friendly.  User starts by entering their employee ID.  Next they input the job and optionally assembly / operation.  They are then presented with a list of buttons per material requirement that they can tap on (or scan) where they are then presented with inventory on hand.  From there they tap the warehouse / bin they wish to pull from, indicate the quantity, and move onto the next material.  When all materials inventory selections have been made, the user clicks the 'Issue Materials' button and all transactions are processed in real time.  This Bezl supports dynamically adding new requirements to a job, although that could be disabled as desired.
items.thumbnailAltText: Screenshot showing a selected job, it's materials, and inventory available for a selected material.

itemImages.imageAltText: Screenshot showing a selected job, it's materials, and inventory available for a selected material.

items.itemDescription: This Bezl allows a production worker to track time from mobile devices (iPhone, iPad, Android, etc.)  Currently it is only configured for Epicor, but will be ported to other systems in the weeks to come.  Bezl is intended to be very barcode friendly.  User starts by entering their employee ID.  From there, they can clock in, clock out, start / stop production activities, and start / stop indirect activities.  The end activity screen for production activities allows for the input of completed quantities as well as scrap.  When clocked onto a production activity, if any attachments were defined at the job level they are presented as buttons that can be tapped to load up into a built-in PDF viewer.
items.thumbnailAltText: Screenshot showing an employee clocked in and logged onto a job.

items.itemDescription: This Bezl allows a production scheduler to assign / prioritize jobs across shop resources in real time.  The drag and drop interface works on any device, so put an iPad in your schedulers hands and let them schedule directly on the shop floor!
items.thumbnailAltText: Screenshot showing a selected work center and the various resources to schedule across

itemImages.imageAltText: Screenshot showing a selected work center and the various resources to schedule across

additionalFiles.description: Sample Excel data source for this Bezl.  Installed by default with latest version of BRDB.

installationNotes.intro:
When you install this Bezl it will by default point to production.xlsx which should already be present on your BRDB server. If you wish to point to a different data source, refer to our standard steps for changing data connections. This Bezl has two data subscriptions that can be edited. First is JobSchedule and this should represent a listing of each job that is currently active on the shop floor. The required columns are:

LocationIntended to represent some physical location where this job is located for filtering purposes. This could be a physical location or any other subclassification desired for jobs.
JobNumberThe job number. If you build assemblies you may wish to concatenate the assembly sequence into this column.
JobDescA text description for the given job. Typically you might consider putting the finished goods part description here.
JobNumberThe job number. If you build assemblies you may wish to concatenate the assembly sequence into this column.
CustomerNameThe name of the customer this job is for.
DueDateThe due date for the given job operation. Since a job may have multiple operations, it may also have separate due dates for each.
WorkCenterSimilar to Location, this column allows you to categorize your job operations according to the work centers they belong.
ResourceIDIf the operation is already scheduled to a resource, that ID should be presented here so it shows in the correct column on the dashboard. If no resource is assigned, leave this field blank.
ResourceSequenceIf this operation has already been scheduled to a resource, this is the numeric ordering of priority the resource should process this operation in relation to others. Typical sequencing would be 10,20,30 but any integer values will do.
ReqQtyThe quantity originally due for this operation.
CompleteQtyThe quantity already completed at this operation.
DueTodayA helper column that gives us a true / falst to know if the operation is due today. This causes the due date field to show as yellow if true.
PastDueAnother helper column to let us know if the given operation is past due. If this column is true, we show the due date column as red.
UniqueIDSome sort of unique value to identify this job and operation row. In our Excel sample we make this simply the job number concatenated with the JobSequence.


The other table this Bezl uses provides the list of available shop resources for assignment to. The required columns are:

LocationIntended to represent some physical location where this resource is located for filtering purposes. This could be a physical location or any other subclassification desired for resources.
ResourceIDThe ID for a given resource. This should have no spaces.
ResourceNameA descriptive name for the resource where spaces are allowed.
WorkCenterSimilar to Location, this column allows you to categorize your resources according to the work centers they belong.


Since this Bezl also saves data you will need to edit the saveChanges function in the custom designer to match up with your data source.

items.itemDescription: This Bezl uses a funnel chart, which consists of multiple segments, each segment representing a data point. The chart lets you slice out a funnel slice to highlight important data.

itemImages.imageAltText: Full image showing a quote to order sales funnel sliced out.

installationNotes.intro: This Bezl is setup by default to point to the funnel.xlsx data source. This comes standard with your BRDB install, but if you are missing this file (located in C:\Program Files (x86)\Bezlio Remote Data Broker\Data\), you can download below to install.

items.itemDescription: This Bezl allows you to run any server based SSRS Report with fresh data directly within Bezlio. Regardless of your device (iPhone, iPad, Android, PC, or Mac) you will be able to run your SSRS Report from anywhere with refreshed data. Parameters are not currently supported, but will be featured in a future release!
items.thumbnailAltText: Screenshot showing an SSRS Report presented within Bezlio.

itemImages.imageAltText: Screenshot showing an SSRS Report presented within Bezlio.

installationNotes.intro: Currently, the default BRDB setup does not include the new SSRS Plugin. You must download the latest version from here and it should be placed at C:\Program Files (x86)\Bezlio Remote Data Broker\Plugins\, which is the default BRDB installation directory. There is also a starting folder parth variable in the Bezl itself, bezl.vars.startingPath, which will need to be modified to your environment.

items.itemDescription: This Bezl uses the latest in mobile 3d technology to enable your users to find inventory in the warehouse faster. A spreadsheet defines the shape and structure of the warehouse and real time queries against the database provide users with a real time visualization of where inventory can be found in the warehouse. On mobile devices users can look from side to side and navigate through the warehouse virtually to assist in the picking process.

itemImages.imageAltText: Screenshot showing virtual warehouse on iPhone
Screenshot showing virtual warehouse on iPad

If you wish to point to a different data source, refer to our standard steps for changing data connections. Required columns names are Id, Description, Bin, and OnHandQty matching the layout. Note that for this Bezl the layout is solely provided in Excel so you will need to input your bin locations into that file.

items.itemDescription: This Bezl uses a waterfall chart to show a graphical representation in changes to cash flow. Values pulled from the GL representing changes to cash flow are plotted to provide a quick glance view how cash position has changed from one month to the next.
